company.name: Fandango, LLC
company.address: 12200 W. Olympic Boulevard, Suite 400, Los Angeles, CA 90064
company.business_description: Fandango provides a website and mobile applications that allow consumers to purchase movie tickets and view showtimes, trailers, and reviews. The company distributes applications through the iTunes App Store and charges service fees when consumers use applications to purchase movie tickets.

case_info.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

complaint.factual_background: Fandango operated a mobile ticketing application for iOS that failed to validate SSL certificates from March 2009 to March 2013, exposing consumers' credit card information and authentication credentials to potential man-in-the-middle attacks on public Wi-Fi networks. Despite claiming to provide secure storage and transmission of payment information, Fandango overrode iOS security defaults, failed to properly test the application, and ignored a security researcher's warning in December 2012. The vulnerability was only fixed after FTC staff contacted the company.

representations_made.description: Claimed that credit card and account information is securely stored on the device and securely transferred during each transaction
representations_made.quoted_text: Your Fandango iPhone Application allows you to store your credit card and Fandango account information on your device so you can conveniently purchase movie tickets. Your information is securely stored on your device and transferred with your approval during each transaction.

representations_made.description: Claimed that consumers can securely purchase tickets without needing an account
representations_made.quoted_text: You don’t need an account to securely purchase tickets.

counts.title: Deceptive Security Representations
counts.representation: Fandango represented that it provides reasonable and appropriate security for ticket purchases made through the Fandango Movies application for iOS
counts.fact: Fandango did not provide reasonable and appropriate security for ticket purchases made through the Fandango Movies application for iOS, as it failed to validate SSL certificates, failed to properly test the application, and failed to maintain adequate processes for receiving security vulnerability reports
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 24 was false or misleading.

definitions.respondent: Fandango, LLC and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.
definitions.Covered information: information from or about an individual consumer, including but not limited to (a) a first and last name; (b) a home or other physical address, including street name and name of city or town; (c) an email address or other online contact information, such as an instant messaging user identifier or a screen name; (d) a telephone number; (e) a Social Security number; (f) a driver's license or other state-issued identification number; (g) a financial institution account number; (h) credit or debit card information; (i) a persistent identifier, such as a customer number held in a "cookie," a static Internet Protocol ("IP") address, a mobile device ID, or processor serial number; (j) precise geo-location data of an individual or mobile device, including GPS-based, WiFi-based, or cell-based location information; or (k) an authentication credential, such as a username or password.
definitions.Computer: any desktop, laptop computer, tablet, handheld device, telephone, or other electronic product or device that has a platform on which to download, install, or run any software program, code, script, or other content and to play any digital audio, visual, or audiovisual content.
definitions.Client software: any program or application developed by respondent or any corporation, subsidiary, division, or affiliate owned or controlled by respondent, that is installed locally on a consumer's computer and that communicates with a server.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of any covered information.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent or its products or services maintain and protect the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of any covered information
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, directly or through any corporation, subsidiary, division, website, or other device or affiliate owned or controlled by respondent, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent or its products or services maintain and protect the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of any covered information.

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive security program reasonably designed to address security risks and protect covered information, with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.

requirements.description: Establish and implement, and thereafter maintain, a comprehensive security program reasonably designed to address security risks and protect the security, integrity and confidentiality of covered information
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall, no later than the date of service of this order, establish and implement, and thereafter maintain, a comprehensive security program that is reasonably designed to (1) address security risks related to the development and management of new and existing products and services for consumers, and (2) protect the security, integrity and confidentiality of covered information, whether collected by respondent or input into, stored on, captured with, or accessed through a computer using respondent’s products or services. Such program, the content and implementation of which must be fully documented in writing, shall contain administrative, technical, and physical safeguards appropriate to respondent’s size and complexity, the nature and scope of respondent’s activities, and the sensitivity of the covered information, including:
requirements.deadline: no later than the date of service of this order

requirements.description: Designate an employee or employees to coordinate and be accountable for the security program
requirements.quoted_text: A. the designation of an employee or employees to coordinate and be accountable for the security program;

requirements.description: Identify material internal and external risks to the security, confidentiality, and integrity of covered information and assess the sufficiency of safeguards in place to control these risks
requirements.quoted_text: B. the identification of material internal and external risks to the security, confidentiality, and integrity of covered information that could result in the unauthorized disclosure, misuse, loss, alteration, destruction, or other compromise of such information, whether such information is in respondent’s possession or is input into, stored on, captured with, or accessed through a computer using respondent’s products or services, and assessment of the sufficiency of any safeguards in place to control these risks.

requirements.description: Conduct risk assessment including consideration of risks in employee training and management, product design and development, secure software design and testing, response to third-party security vulnerability reports, and prevention, detection, and response to attacks, intrusions, or systems failures
requirements.quoted_text: C. at a minimum, this risk assessment required by Subpart B should include consideration of risks in each area of relevant operation, including, but not limited to, (1) employee training and management, including in secure engineering and defensive programming; (2) product design and development; (3) secure software design, development, and testing; (4) review, assessment, and response to third-party security vulnerability reports, and (5) prevention, detection, and response to attacks, intrusions, or systems failures;

requirements.description: Design and implement reasonable safeguards to control identified risks, and regularly test or monitor the effectiveness of the safeguards' key controls, systems, and procedures
requirements.quoted_text: D. the design and implementation of reasonable safeguards to control the risks identified through risk assessment, and regular testing or monitoring of the effectiveness of the safeguards’ key controls, systems, and procedures, including through reasonable and appropriate software security testing techniques;

requirements.description: Develop and use reasonable steps to select and retain service providers capable of maintaining security practices consistent with this order, and require service providers by contract to implement and maintain appropriate safeguards
requirements.quoted_text: E. the development and use of reasonable steps to select and retain service providers capable of maintaining security practices consistent with this order, and requiring service providers by contract to implement and maintain appropriate safeguards; and

requirements.description: Evaluate and adjust respondent's security program in light of testing and monitoring results, any material changes to operations or business arrangements, or any other circumstances that may have a material impact on the effectiveness of its security program
requirements.quoted_text: F. the evaluation and adjustment of respondent’s security program in light of the results of the testing and monitoring required by subpart B, any material changes to respondent’s operations or business arrangements, or any other circumstances that respondent knows or has reason to know may have a material impact on the effectiveness of its security program.

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: For any product or service offered through client software, respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments from qualified professionals for twenty years.

requirements.description: Obtain initial and biennial assessments from a qualified, objective, independent third-party professional using procedures and standards generally accepted in the profession
requirements.quoted_text: order, for any product or service offered through client software, respondent shall obtain initial and biennial assessments and reports (“Assessments”) from a qualified, objective, independent third-party professional, who uses procedures and standards generally accepted in the profession.

requirements.description: Initial Assessment must cover the first one hundred eighty (180) days after service of the order
requirements.quoted_text: Avenue, NW, Washington, D.C. 20580. The reporting period for the Assessments shall cover: (1) the first one hundred eighty (180) days after service of the order for the initial Assessment; and (2) each two (2) year period thereafter for twenty (20) years after service of the order for the

requirements.description: Biennial Assessments must cover each two (2) year period thereafter for twenty (20) years after service of the order
requirements.quoted_text: and (2) each two (2) year period thereafter for twenty (20) years after service of the order for the biennial Assessments. Each Assessment shall:

requirements.description: Each Assessment must be prepared and completed within sixty (60) days after the end of the reporting period
requirements.quoted_text: Each Assessment shall be prepared and completed within sixty (60) days after the end of the reporting period to which the Assessment applies. Respondent shall provide the initial

requirements.description: Provide the initial Assessment to the Associate Director for Enforcement within ten (10) days after the Assessment has been prepared
requirements.quoted_text: reporting period to which the Assessment applies. Respondent shall provide the initial Assessment to the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, Washington, D.C. 20580, within ten (10) days after the Assessment has been prepared. All subsequent biennial Assessments shall be retained by respondent until the order is

requirements.description: Retain all subsequent biennial Assessments until the order is terminated and provide to the Associate Director of Enforcement within ten (10) days of request
requirements.quoted_text: prepared. All subsequent biennial Assessments shall be retained by respondent until the order is terminated and provided to the Associate Director of Enforcement within ten (10) days of 4

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC various records related to compliance with the order, including assessment materials and compliance documents.

requirements.description: Maintain for a period of three (3) years after the date of preparation of each Assessment all materials relied upon to prepare the Assessment, including plans, reports, studies, reviews, audits, policies, training materials, and assessments relating to compliance with Parts II and III
requirements.quoted_text: A. for a period of three (3) years after the date of preparation of each Assessment required under Part III of this order, all materials relied upon to prepare the Assessment, whether prepared by or on behalf of the respondent, including but not limited to all plans, reports, studies, reviews, audits, audit trails, policies, training materials, and assessments, and any other materials relating to respondent’s compliance with Parts II and III of this order, for the compliance period covered by such Assessment;

requirements.description: Maintain for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination all advertisements and promotional materials containing any representations covered by this order, as well as all materials used or relied upon in making or disseminating the representation
requirements.quoted_text: B. unless covered by IV.A, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all other documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: i. all advertisements and promotional materials containing any representations covered by this order, as well as all materials used or relied upon in making or disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination any documents that contradict, qualify, or call into question respondent's compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: B. unless covered by IV.A, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all other documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: i. all advertisements and promotional materials containing any representations covered by this order, as well as all materials used or relied upon in making or disseminating the representation; and ii. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that contradict, qualify, or call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future subsidiaries, personnel, and representatives with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver a copy of this order to all current and future subsidiaries, principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future subsidiaries, current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current

requirements.description: Deliver this order to current subsidiaries and personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order
requirements.quoted_text: relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current subsidiaries and personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future subsidiaries and personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or

requirements.description: Deliver this order to future subsidiaries and personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: subsidiaries and personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future subsidiaries and personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part

requirements.description: For any business entity resulting from any change in structure, deliver the order at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure
requirements.quoted_text: responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part 5 VI, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure. Respondent must

requirements.description: Secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order
requirements.quoted_text: secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Change in Corporate Structure Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or change in name or address.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, bankruptcy petition, or change in corporate name or address
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address. Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

requirements.description: If respondent learns of a proposed change fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of the order, and submit additional reports upon request.

requirements.description: File with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of

requirements.description: Submit an additional true and accurate written report within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on August 13, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date the United States or the Commission files a complaint alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on August 13, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on August 13, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on August 13, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
